          Passport Services
    Appointments
First-time Applicants
Lost Passports, Stolen Passports, Corrections, and Name Changes
Fees Summary
Payment Information
Application Status & Assistance
Travel Requirements
Appointments
Passport services are available by appointment only, Monday and Wednesday, 9 a.m. to 3 p.m., excluding holidays.
Walk-ins are welcome for passport photos only.
Schedule an appointment.
Submit your passport-related inquiries.
Schedule Passport Appointment     Submit a Question
Passport Application Types & Requirements
New Applicants
All new applicants must appear in person and complete a DS-11 form. Passport services are open to all U.S. citizens.
Supplemental Requirements:
Proof of U.S. Citizenship (Original only; no photocopies):
Certified birth certificate
Previous U.S. passport (if applicable)
Certificate of Naturalization or Citizenship
Report of Birth Abroad
CA Applicants: Must submit a state-certified Certificate of Live Birth (abstracts/hospital records not accepted)
Proof of Identity (with photo & signature):
Valid driver's license
Government-issued ID
Recent Certificate of Naturalization/Citizenship
If no ID, bring an identifying witness and complete DS-71
One passport photo
Available at City Clerk’s Office, Office of Records (1st Floor, City Hall) for $15.00 (cash, check, credit, or debit card)
Payment:
Application Fee (Check/money order to U.S. Department of State)
Ages 16 and older: $130.00
Ages 16 and under: $100.00
Acceptance Fee: $35.00
Parental Consent for Minors:
Ages 16 and under: Consent from both parents/legal guardians
Ages 16-17: Applicant must appear with one parent/guardian
Lost Passports, Stolen Passports, Corrections, and Name Changes
If your valid passport is lost or stolen, or if you need corrections and name changes, you must go to travel.state.gov.

Payment Information:
Fees to the U.S. Department of State must be paid by check, cashier’s check, or money order only. NO cash, credit, or debit cards accepted.
For passport photos services, please note that the City accepts cash, check, credit, or debit cards payments.
Application Status & Assistance
For questions about the status of your application:
Call: 1-877-487-2778 (Prompt #3)
TTY/TDD: 1-877-874-7793
Website: travel.state.gov
Travel Requirements
Under the Western Hemisphere Travel Initiative (WHTI), U.S. citizens re-entering the U.S. by land or sea from Canada, Mexico, Bermuda, or the Caribbean must present one of the following:
Passport book
Passport card
Other DHS-approved travel documents
International air travel requires a passport book.
